title: What should I do to save Bookmarks in Firefox when changing desktop computer?
content: Tried the instruction to use import & back up but box appears for exporting files but its blank and I cannot populate the box. I want to back up bookmarks prior to changing to a new computer (desktop tower using MS Windows 10)
creator: getdavidholloway

title: Opt into collection for interaction data, but not for technical data
content:
This is in regard to the privacy settings under about:preferences#privacy > 'Allow firefox to send technical & interaction data to Mozilla' where I'm willing to opt into just interaction data, but not willing give my technical data, because of the temporary collection of my IP address. Due to this, I have to opt it out completely & unfortunately couldn't contribute to mozilla's data collection stats. If there's anyway to split those separately, would be better.

Thank you, Prince Cooper
creator: pcoop

title: Digital signature - Java not supported
content: When trying to use digital signature, there is a error message that "your current browser version no longer supports java." How to fix it?

title: unable to click links etc
content: every few minutes while browsing there will be some kind of glitch where the mouse stops interacting with anything on the page, doesnt chage cursor type on mouseover for links, etc. the scroll wheel still functions, thats it. i have to reload the page every time in order to get it working again. its starting to ger really tedious, so i would appreciate some help resolving this issue immensely, thanks!

title: Firefox Ereignis-ID 1155
content: I get the following message in the event viewer once a day: The description for Event ID "1155" from source "Firefox Default Browser Agent" could not be found. What do I have to do to stop getting the message?
creator: Glockenturm

title: Permanently pin the tab of an addon
content:
I use the Feedbro-Addon, which creates an own tab. Its url is: moz-extension://285d678c-ecb3-4003-923d-835fc9d8e0bc/reader.html

If I use it as a normal tab (instead of a pinned tab) ... it survives a Firefox restart. But if I use it as a pinned tab (which I want) ... it disappears after a Firefox restart.

I suppose it has to do with it being an addon-page instead of a "normal" page.

Is there a way to make it stay permanently pinned?
creator: thomasvonderelbe

title: Multi-account containers, multiple gmail accounts - signing out issue
content:
I'm trying to keep my work gmail and personal gmail in separate containers. I've assigned mail.google.com and accounts.google.com to my Work container, and it works fine in that container.

When I try to sign IN to my personal gmail in a personal tab, it still works fine if I select "Would you still like to open in this current Container?" -> "Open in container". But when I sign OUT, I get the same prompt multiple times and each opening a new tab. I believe this is because gmail does some redirecting during the sign-out process. If I don't go through all these container prompts, I don't get signed out.

I'm probably missing something obvious, but how exactly do I achieve different gmail accounts in different containers if they all use the same domain?

Cheers!
creator: iainure56
